metadata.title: CVE-2021-2011 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Client product of Oracle MySQL (component: CAPI). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.32 and prior and 8.0.22and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticatedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLClient. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) ofMySQL Client. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-router - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mariadb-10.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
